text.section: If advisable in a specific proceeding, a court may appoint an auditor, surveyor, court reporter, assistant counsel for the State, counsel for a party if authorized by law or rule, accountant, master, examiner, or other officer, and may require his presence in court.

A special officer shall receive the compensation provided by this subsection:
Auditor -- Reasonable compensation as set by the court, but not less than $15 for stating an account.
Assistant counsel for the State or counsel for a party -- The amount set by the court but in Baltimore City no appearance fees in a criminal case unless taxed against and paid by the accused as costs.
Surveyor or assistant surveyor -- The fee charged by members of the Maryland Society of Surveyors in the county for similar services.
Other officer -- Reasonable compensation as set by the court.
A special officer's fee may be taxed as costs or paid by the county.
